From the v-t graph, the pedestrian runs at a constant speed of 8 m/s.
The pedestrian's motion is uniform, and the distance traveled by the pedestrian at any time t is given by x_pedestrian = v_pedestrian * t = 8t.
From the v-t graph, the bus starts moving with uniform acceleration when the green light turns on. The bus's velocity increases linearly from v = 0 at t = 0.
The slope of the bus's velocity graph gives its acceleration: a_bus = Δv/Δt = 8 m/s / 8 s = 1 m/s².
The bus's velocity at any time t is v_bus = a_bus * t = 1t.
The distance traveled by the bus at any time t is obtained using the equation for uniformly accelerated motion: x_bus = 1/2 * a_bus * t² = 1/2 * (1) * t² = 1/2 * t².
The pedestrian starts 36 meters behind the bus when the green light turns on.
The position of the bus relative to the pedestrian at any time t is x_relative = x_bus - x_pedestrian = 1/2 * t² - 8t + 36.
For the pedestrian to catch up with the bus, the relative position x_relative must become zero: 1/2 * t² - 8t + 36 = 0.
